message: This is my room at the Fish Scale Inn.
Thanks to Mrs. Hudson tidying up so often, the room is so organized I can hardly believe it's mine.
I'm really starting to get tired...
I wish I could get a nap in before heading out to the pub.
I finally made it back to my room, but there's still stuff I've got to do from here on out.

I need to talk things over with Gardner and Thomas about what's next, and Mrs. Hudson looked like she wanted to say something too, but more than anything, I have to get the bartender at the Gilman House to tell me about the old man I met at the ruins. I wonder if I'll even be able to get into bed safely tonight......
The old window frame creaks and groans in the wind blowing in from the sea.

It's only about six feet from the row of rooftops across the street. If you wanted to, it's not a distance you couldn't jump across. I just hope nobody gets any ideas about coming at me while I'm asleep...

The paranoia that someone might be peeking from the other side of the Curtain still hasn't gone away. I should stop thinking about it. At times like this, it's better for my mental health to just go to sleep quickly.
If I lie down, I'll probably fall asleep right away.
The next time I wake up, it'll probably already be morning. Guess I can't lie down after all.
There's still a while before I head out to the Gilman House......
Who knows if I'll be able to sleep well tonight, so maybe it's a good idea to get a quick nap in while I can.
I lay down on the Bed.
A pleasant sleepiness washes over me, and before I know it, I'm swallowed into the depths of sleep.

name: Voice
message: Jonathan, why don’t you notice my words？

name: Voice
message: Jonathan, why won't you try to see my dreams？

name: Voice
message: Jonathan, you have to remember.
《...We now gather here to create more of our kin, so we’ll be ready for that day...》

name: Voice
message: Jonathan, you need to know this.
《...We will multiply abundantly and, on that day, properly nourish the gods...》

name: Voice
message: Jonathan, you have to get it.
《...Respond to our preparations, you who must fulfill the covenant of our god...》

name: Voice
message: What we've done. What we gotta do.

name: Voice
message: Books, and a sacrifice！

name: Jonathan
message: ......I wonder what time it is now.

name: Jonathan
message: 随分眠ってしまったようだが‥‥‥‥‥‥

name: Jonathan
message: Damn it！
I jumped out of bed in a hurry.
The hands of the clock have long since passed midnight.
I have to hurry.
If I don't make it before the pub girl falls asleep, who knows what the old man will say to me in the morning！

I ended up lying down on the bed with my clothes still on, so my suit got pretty wrinkled. But there's no time to fix that. I wonder how long it'll take to walk through the unfamiliar village streets to Gilman House at night.
It's still too early to go to sleep.
Unfortunately, I don't have the guts to disobey the cranky old man's orders and wake up the sleeping tiger.
I lightly knocked on the door connecting to Gardner's room.
After a brief pause, Gardner appears accompanied by the sweet-smelling smoke of pipe tobacco.

name: Gardner
message: やっと戻ってきたのかね？
I've thought this for a while now, but don't you have a tendency to waste way too much time?
ガードナーに会うなら食堂に行った方がよさそうだ。
It's the door that leads to Gardner's room next door. Right now, it's locked from both my side and the other side.
どうせせっかちなガードナーの事だから、さっさと食事をしに行ってしまったんだろう。ノックをしても無駄というものだ。
なんとも味気ない部屋だ。広さ自体は私のロンドンのアパートメントとそれほど変わりないが、これで絵の一枚もかかっていれば随分違うだろうに。ハドスン夫人はそういう趣味はないのだろうか。
It's as quiet as ever. There's everything I need, but nothing else. Even if it's just for two or three days, isn't this a little too bleak?

name: Jonathan
message: I made a deal with the bartender-I'm only supposed to go after midnight, and by myself.

name: Gardner
message: By yourself？
I can't go too? That's harsh. Even though you're saying it's a rare chance.

name: Jonathan
message: It'll be fine, I'll make sure to ask the old man about it properly.

Gardner still had a puzzled look on his face, but it seemed like he finally gave up. Now he can't treat me badly even if he wants to. I need to make him realize that things aren't as easy as dealing with college students.

name: Gardner
message: Can't be helped.
Alright, then I'll take my time hearing about your results tomorrow morning.

name: Jonathan
message: Got it.

name: Gardner
message: Now that’s settled, I’m going to bed！
I'm　totally　worn　out　today,　so　much　stuff　happened.

name: Jonathan
message: Are you going to bed already？
Even though there's still a while before I have to go out.

name: Gardner
message: No point in staying awake, is there？
Alright, I'm counting on you.

name: Jonathan
message: What a terrible person......

name: Gardner
message: From now on, don't knock on my room until morning！
I don't like being disturbed in the middle of my sleep.
They've gone‥‥‥‥‥
What a selfish old man, he really does only see me as an errand boy or a student about to fail his credits！

name: Gardner
message: Jonathan, I'm sorry to bring this up again and again, but it's about that old man...
Gardner seems pretty obsessed with that old man. But, well, it makes sense. After all, he might finally get his hands on the secret of the ruins that’s always been a complete mystery.
That said, letting things keep going at this guy's pace forever isn't any fun.
It'd be smart to do them a favor here and even things up, so we're on equal footing.

name: Jonathan
message: "Jonathan" You want me to pump the bartender at the Gilman House for info, right？

name: Gardner
message: そう、その事だよ。
Isn't there some good way to do this, what do you think？

name: Jonathan
message: 教授、パブで粗野な村人に絡まれた時、バーテンが私　　　　　　　　の耳元で何かを囁いていたのにお気づきになりません　　　　　　　　でしたか。

name: Gardner
message: "Gardner", you say.........？

name: Jonathan
message: "Jonathan" Actually, at that time, the bartender and I agreed to meet again at the pub at night.

name: Gardner
message: Really？
Well done, Jonathan. You look meek but you're pretty good at this！

name: Jonathan
message: "Jonathan" There's no other motive, you know, I'm just going purely to get information！

name: Gardner
message: Don't be so modest. I always thought you were a man with potential.

name: Jonathan
message: Come on, cut it out... I'm not like that.

name: Gardner
message: It's fine, isn't it?
Well, anyway, let's head out right now！
Entrance hall
Dining room
Madam's room
Madam's room
Gardner's room
Thomas's room
Unfortunately, I don't have the guts to break the orders of the crotchety old man and wake the sleeping tiger. Wouldn't it be wiser to just wait until tomorrow morning？
Gardner should have been back from dinner by now.
Wouldn't it be enough to just knock on the door？
